Text: Mark was an American and loved football. Finn was Irish and told Mark he loved football too. Mark invited Finn over to watch a football match. Once the game began, Finn told Mark he was very confused. Mark was clearly much better than Finn at football. Mark and Finn laughed once they realized Finn called soccer football.
Mary ate pudding every day. She ate it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. One day she ran out of pudding. She then decided to become a chef. Mary never made pudding as a chef. Mary loved sweets.

Kat was watching a scary movie in the living room. Right in the middle of a climactic scene, the TV cut off. Kat jumped up, afraid and looked behind the TV. Kat saw that her cat had accidentally unplugged the TV. Kat laughed at herself when she realized how silly her fright was. Kat continued to be scared.

Sam wrote a letter to his mother. He dropped off the letter in the mailbox. He was surprised to find that his mother did not receive his letter. She waited for a month for it to arrive. Sam tried to send his letter again. Sam's mother was happy that the letter never came.

Louisa is trying to think of the perfect gift for her grandson. She decides to knit him a pair of mittens. Louisa buys a bright red spool of yarn for the mittens. Her grandson is very happy when he sees his new mittens. Her grandson is upset with Louisa. Her grandson thanks Louisa for the wonderful gift.

Kelly was rushing to get to her flight on time. Unfortunately, security was taking forever. By the time she left security, she checked the time. It was six and her flight left a half hour ago. Kelly boarded the plane. Kelly had to schedule another flight.

My daughter was riding a horse named Simba. Something spooked him and he raised his front legs. This threw my daughter off of his back and into the fence. She was hurt and we took her to the ER. During routine scans, they found another hidden issue. Fortunately, she was just very bruised and sore.

David was walking home from school. He heard a tiny bark behind him. A small black puppy was following him home. He asked his mom if he could keep it. David's mom took him to get a kitten. His mom said yes he could keep the puppy.

Ryan and Sam like to go to the movies together. They always get to the movie theater early. That way, they Ryan can have popcorn, Sam can have nachos and they can watch the previews. One time, they clumsily dropped their popcorn on the theater floor. The movie wasn't as much fun without popcorn. They were both sad to not have their favorite movie snack.

Alice was pregnant. She went to the doctor. They scanned her stomach with the ultrasound. Then they told her the sex of her baby. Alice didn't know to give her baby a boy or girl name. She decided on the name "Pat" for her new baby.

All of the registers were full at the grocery store. Joe picked the shortest line and waited. When it was his turn he threw all his food on the belt. Joe barked at the cashier to scan his food quickly. Joe was happy to be having such a good day. The cashier unhappily obliged.

I always wanted to get a dog in our family. I would take care of it all the time so nobody had to worry. It was one thing I always wanted since five years ago. Today, my wish finally came true because my parents surprised me. It has been years since my dog died, and I am still sad. They bought me the best dog ever so I could take care of it.

Every summer my son's grandma plants a beautiful garden. Often times, she will ask for my son's help to pick out flowers. They take a full morning to drive to the store and peruse the choices. In the end, he picks out pretty purple and pink flowers just for her. My son is thoughtless. My son loves his grandma.

Angelina wants to make an apple pie. She has the apples but they need to be peeled. She starts peeling. Finally, they are all peeled. Angelina finishes making the apple pie. Angelina is finally ready to make a chocolate cake.

Avery needed to get to work. She wanted to take the bus or a cab. She found she had no money, credit cards or tokens. She realized that she had no options but to walk. Avery was happy about her financial situation. Avery put on her shoes and began her trek.

Braden wanted to be a male model. He sent in some photos to an agency. Soon he got a call from them. Braden was ecstatic to hear they liked his pictures. Braden got hired to the modeling job. Braden called back saying he didn't want the job anymore.

Tom was gay. He lived in a town that wasn't friendly towards gays. Every day he was teased. One day, tom moved away and met a great guy. Once in a serious relationship, he realized he was not gay. Now Tom lives in a mansion at the top of a giant hill.

One day, Pete went to the park. It was a beautiful day, and the park was quiet. Pete sat on a bench and began working on a crossword puzzle. He finished the crossword puzzle in record time. Pete cursed at himself. Pete walked back home, feeling smart.

It was Mother's Day and Jill wanted to do something special for her mom. She got up early so she could fix her mom breakfast. Everything started off well, with toast and pancakes. Unfortunately, she burned the toast to a crisp. But Jill's mother was grateful anyway. Jill's mother told her she was worthless.

This winter, Billy had decided he wanted to grow up, leave his parents house, live on his own. It was a fairly cold winter. Inadvertently, Billy had been running his heater on high for over a week. His electric bill came in and was much higher than he could afford. Billy decided to borrow some money from his father to pay the bill. Billy decided to set up a payment plan.

Gina and her friends had been given permission to go to the library. And had arrived to find the door locked. A teacher spotted the girls sitting in the hall. She wanted to see their hall pass. The girls started dancing. The girls have her their passes.

Tim parked his car and open his back trunk. He grabbed his surfing board and put on his wetsuit. Tim was about to jump into the water when the guard stopped him. Sharks attacked many people and several injured. He was angry at the guard for stopping him. He was glad he didn't jump into the waters.

It was the start of a new school year. I wanted to buy a new book bag because I did not want to use the old one. Everyone was buying a new one, and mine was tattered. My mom decided to add more details to my old one to make it look new. However, it was so old that it ended up falling apart after a month. I was happy I had my own customized book bag.

Mia had taken a long time at the store picking out the perfect gift. She finally approached the register. To her dismay, she found she was five dollars short in cash! After putting the item back, she started walking out of the store. Mia then decided to steal the gift instead. Mia was upset she couldn't buy the gift.

I went to the mall with my family. I bought many clothes from my favorite store. My mom and dad paid for everything. It was a dream come true. I didn't like the items I got. I love going to the mall with them.

Bobby always enjoyed watching the snow fall. When snow begins to fall from the sky he watches it. Sometimes he'll go out and stand and watch. He always thought that the snow always sounded and felt nice. Bobby went outside to build a snowman. Bobby let the snowfall between his fingers.

John was an architect who had recently gotten his master's degree. He was excited to start his new job as a designer in a big firm. He spent years doing small work on bigger projects for the experience. Three years later, he was the lead designer on a big building project! All of those years of sacrifice and small work had finally paid off! He finally had his dream job!

Jane was staying at a hotel. She took the elevator to the top floor to see the view. When the elevator doors opened the fire alarm was sounding. Hotel staff told Jane to evacuate. Jane ignored them and took the stairs to the top to see the view. Jane had to take the stairs all the way to the bottom.

We were on vacation, visiting great historical sites. On our last day, we went to a mysterious island. The tour guide said this is where political dissidents were exiled. We decided to explore the island on our own and left the tour. We then got a tour guide to show us around. We rented some bicycles and enjoyed traveling around the island.

Lacey had a bunch of chickens. One day, she realized one had laid an egg! She was so excited until she realized the egg was cold. She asked her son about it. Her son didn't know what she was talking about. Her son had taken an egg from the icebox and put it in the nest.

Evan was starting high school. He was very nervous. He feared no one would talk to him. But then he found that all the students were very kind to him. Evan decided to quit high school. Evan decided he liked high school.

Jordan met Sally over two years ago and got into a relationship. Suddenly Sally got distant from Jordan. Jordan heard through a friend that Sally was seeing another guy. Jordan confronted Sally and she admitted to seeing another guy. Jordan was sad and broke off his relationship with Sally. Jordan was excited and took Sally out to dinner.

Eli was at a party with older kids. They decided to start drinking beer. He tried to fit in and drank some too. He got sick and threw up all over the living room. Eli's parents felt proud about the choices he made. Eli's parents found out and were angry at him.
Tom wanted an iced latte. So he went to a coffee shop and ordered one. But over half of it was ice. Tom complained. They gave Tom a new latte with less ice. They gave Tom a new latte with more ice.

Taj loved to eat McDonald's. He wrote McDonald's an email appreciating them for their service. A McDonald's representative was able to reply the next day. Taj got fifty dollars worth of McDonald's coupons in the mail! He was sad about getting the coupons. He invited some friends to have lunch with him at McDonald's.

Ida really wanted hardwood floors in her living room. She worked overtime often to save up the money. Then she shopped for the flooring and had it installed. When she saw her new hardwood floors, she almost cried. Ida thought the hardwood floors made her house feel like a home. Ida thought the new floors were terrible.

Tim walked two miles to the convenience store. He was craving a candy bar. He got the candy bar and went to the counter. Outside, he unwrapped the candy and took a bite. He was disgusted to realize that he accidentally bought a protein bar. It was his least favorite snack.

Erica had to decide whether to take her final or go help friends. School was important to her, but her friend was in an emergency. Erica told her professor about her situation. The professor said she could make up the final at a later date. Erica told her professor that she was being unfair. Erica was so grateful that her professor was understanding.

The harpooner struck the whale, which thrashed and began its run. For a few minutes, all was well, but then the whale sounded deep. The line could not pay out fast enough, and the bow dipped deep. The boat slipped below the waves and did not come back up. The harpooner went down with the ship. The harpooner emerged on a surfboard.

Billy was not a nice boy. He liked to bully the smaller children. One day, he went too far and injured another child. The child suffered brain damage as a result. Billy was arrested for assault on the child. Billy was more popular than ever now.

It was the first day of a new school. I was very scared to meet new people. I did not know if they would like me. Class had just started, and I noticed a big card and cupcakes at the front of the room. It was an unfriendly welcome. Everyone was very kind and welcoming.

I had an interview yesterday. I was very nervous. I could not come up with anything during the interview. Then the hiring manager gave me a cup of tea and told me to relax. That made me more anxious. I felt better and performed well.

Today was my first time trying seafood. I ordered shrimp. It was delicious, but I soon felt sick. Minutes later, I couldn't breathe and went to the hospital. I learned that I am allergic and will never have shrimp again. I ate shrimp at the hospital.

I really wanted to make a snowman last week. There was plenty of time and snow. Unfortunately, I didn't have any gloves good enough. I had lost all the pairs that wouldn't soak through. Then I went out and built a snowman. Sadly I had to skip building a snowman.

Travis always stayed up until midnight. He never got a good night of sleep. One night he drank a glass of warm milk. Travis went to bed early. He woke up feeling extremely tired from staying up. He woke up feeling better than he had in a long time.

Eddie's dad took him to a wrestling show. Eddie loved the whole show! Afterward, he got a wrestler's autograph. He decided wrestlers were the best guys ever. Eddie never watched wrestling again. Eddie had the best day with his dad!
Aya wanted to grow her own flowers. She bought seeds at the garden store. She planted them and watered them. Soon she had little sprouts! Aya was thrilled! Aya hated plants.

Coach Reid implemented a rigorous boot camp for preseason. Every night the players would do a series of military exercises. The coaches hoped this would instill discipline within the players. Although at the time, the players resented it, they grew as a team. Discipline in sports is an important thing to learn. The players learned nothing from their boot camp.

Jane always jogged through the same neighborhood. One day there was a big scary dog, but it was being led on a leash. The dog got away and lunged at Jane, leash trailing behind. Jane needed stitches on her arm from the bite. Jane decided not to go swimming anymore. After that, she decided to carry mace with her when jogging.

Tina was a twelve-year-old girl who went away to a one-week summer camp. The camp was very nice and they had a lot of fun activities there. Also, Tina got to make several new friends. However, Tina got homesick before the end of the week. Tina had a great time. She was glad when the week was over and she got to go home.
Ken was eating at a cafe. He found a bug in his drink. Ken was disgusted. He called over the waiter. The waiter and manager gave him his food for free. The waiter charged him double.

Nina was trying to quit drinking. She decided to join a support group. She went to their meetings every week. In a few weeks, she was handling her cravings much better. Nina was unable to control her addictions at all. Nina was on the road to recovery.

Max had been dating Maddie for three years. He had never met her family. He felt very suspicious and told Maddie he wanted to meet them. Maddie was worried because she had a secret. Maddie wondered how Max would react to her two dads. Maddie couldn't wait for Max to meet her family.

Tim rented a car to visit his ill mother. Tim's mother was in a nursing home in Detroit. While on his way to the nursing home, Tim was in a car accident. The tow truck driver offered to drop off Tim at the nursing home. Tim told the driver to take him to Toronto. Tim was very thankful.

There was this amazing Mexican joint right by my dorm. I would walk there a few times a week and eat tacos. The best part was that they were open all night. I went down there one night I found out they closed. I was really disappointed and hungrier than ever. I enjoyed a great Chinese dinner there.
Adam was in history class. He was bored. Adam carved his name into his desk. Adam was caught. He left class and went home. He had to stay after school and sand the desk.

Caleb loved to play baseball. Caleb was an outfielder on his team. One day someone hit a ball far out near Caleb! Caleb ran out to catch it but it hit him right in the nose! All the kids congratulated him on a job well done. All the kids laughed at him.

Becky's grandmother had promised her a special book. It had been handwritten by her great-grandfather. When Becky's grandmother died, her cousin took the book! Becky was very angry and wrote to her cousin a plaintive letter. Becky and her cousin both had copies of the book. Her cousin then mailed her the book back.

Sue got married last Saturday. She almost didn't make it to the wedding. She got stuck in traffic. Luckily a kind policeman saw what was happening. The policeman got Due to the wedding on time. Sue was arrested.

There was nothing Pollyanna liked better than nuts. Pollyanna was a very clever Cockatoo. When she saw a dish of nuts in the living room, she wanted them. After her owner left, she pried open her cage door with her beak. She proceeded to eat all the nuts in the dish. Then she fell asleep in her cage.

Jill went on a road trip last month. She wanted to travel from Boston to Seattle. Halfway through, her car broke down. She spent hours on the side of the road, waiting for AAA. Jill was glad that they arrived so quickly. They fixed her car and sent her on her way.

Jane was paranoid and valued her privacy. She went out to the mall to look for a privacy filter. At the mobile shop, she found one that would fit her phone. She had them install the privacy filter. She shared her phone number with all her friends. That helped her feel more relaxed.

Alfred and Arthur had been best friends when they were children. Unfortunately, when they got older, they began to fight. They stopped talking to each other for a few years. Finally, they managed to reconcile. They were both sad they had reconciled. They were both happy to be friends again.

The cook pushed deep into the jungle. He ignored the biting insects and sweltering heat. He was determined to find the rare ingredient for his dish. He suddenly gasped in surprise! He was too hot and decided to turn around and leave. He found a rare plant.

Ever since I was little I used one blanket. It was so soft and worn out. It had so many memories so I could not let go of it. I always kept it near me. It was my favorite childhood memory. Then one day my dad shrunk it in the dryer.

Mike was very sleepy and hungry. But he had to stay up to finish work. He thought eating food would help him stay up longer. So he put some bread in his toaster. When it was done he put in some butter and ate it. He couldn't figure out what to eat.

My family and I decided to buy a new car. I loved going to the car showroom and looking. My family decided on the best car ever. It was so big and I am sure everyone loved it. We started using public transportation. We took it home and it fit perfectly with us.

Joe woke up to a lot of loud noises outside. It sounded very bad, very windy. He turned on the news and saw that there was a tornado warning! The warning said to take cover immediately! Joe yawned and shuffled outside to get the mail. Joe quickly collected his things and went to the shelter.

The office worker claimed she was the best multitasker in the world. Her boss wanted her to prove it, so she gave her a bunch of jobs. The worker cracked her knuckles and began the list of jobs. The worker worked with great flurry and speed. The office worker gave up and checked into rehab. All projects were completed on time and all were correct.

Two countries were competing for resources and global recognition. The two countries disagreed on some fundamental issues. One country declared war on the other and invaded. The two countries fought for many years. The second country joined the first country against a third. Both countries were ravaged by war.

Mariko took her friend Julie to try ramen. Julie had never had ramen that wasn't instant dry noodles before. She eagerly tried the ramen. It was so good, she ordered a second bowl. She poured the contents into the garbage and washed the bowl. Julie decided it was her new favorite food.

Peter was excited about the class field trip. He was looking forward to visiting the science museum. The place had many cool exhibits and interactive displays. Peter was fascinated by the physics and space demonstrations. Peter hated science. Peter grew up to be a scientist.

Tina was diagnosed with a terrible disease. She was told she would only have a month to live. Tina was beside herself. She tried a plant-based diet during her final weeks. It ended up curing her disease. It helped with the pain, but nothing more.

Georgia was carving a pumpkin. First, she put it on the table, on top of some newspaper. Then, she cut the top off and scraped out all of the seeds. Finally, she used a large knife to carve a face in the pumpkin. When Georgia was done, she. Georgia made a great looking pumpkin when she finished.

I was studying for school this afternoon and became very thirsty. I decided to take a break to get something to drink. I went to the kitchen, but the refrigerator was empty. I got a glass of water and filled it with water. After I drank the water, I went back to studying. Then I poured the water on my school books.

I wanted to play sports when I was younger. I tried several different sports. I tried baseball, hockey, and soccer. I quit most of them. I wasn't any good at playing sports. I was very good at every sport I tried.

George was taking a hot shower. Suddenly, the water became very cold. George quickly jumped out of the shower. Shivering, he used a towel to dry off. George then felt too hot so he needed to cool off. He realized that his hot water ran out.

My boyfriend's name is Reggie. Reggie and I have been together for one year. In that one year, we have been through so much together. We have grown to love one another through good times and bad. I really do adore our relationship. We fight all the time.
I decided to join a poker tournament. It was a hundred dollar buy in. I played very smartly. I was on the last table, head to head. I eventually won. While they dealt the cards I left for Mexico.

Samantha was happy to go away for the summer. She told all of her friends that she was going to Hawaii. At the last minute, her brother gets sick. Samantha vacation was canceled. Samantha was ecstatic! Samantha was so disappointed!

Gina lost her key for the second time in eight months. Last time she replaced it without her parents knowing. But she had no money to buy a new one now. Gina knew her parents would be upset. Her parents stole her key. So she borrowed the money from a friend.

My brother and I always compete at carving Jack-o-Lanterns. We try to see who can carve the craziest face. I carved a face comprised entirely of different-sized squares. My brother carved a face in a strange spiral pattern. I tripped and spilled a bowl of Halloween candy on the porch. My mother said she thought mine was the oddest looking.

David had homework to finish. He said down at his desk and took out his book. David could not concentrate on his assignment. He sat there for a long time. David finished his assignment in record time. David gave up and put his book away.
The girls went to a casino. All decided to play some slot machines. None won any money. In fact, all lost money. They felt terrible about losing all of their money. The girls were very pleased.

Jon just broke up with his girlfriend. He was feeling quite depressed. He called up his friends for support. His friends came to pick up Jon. Jon spent the rest of the night with friends. Jon was angry at his friends.

At the restaurant, the waiter gave me the wrong food. I asked the waiter for the correct dinner. The waiter brought me another incorrect order! They messed up my order twice. I left without paying the waiter a tip. I left the waiter a large tip.

Gina's dad and mom were sitting in the garage. They had the door open and could see their cars in the driveway. Her niece was sitting in her dad's car in the driver seat. Gina was surprised her parents let the kids play in the car. Gina's dad didn't know she was in the car, he got upset. Gina told her dad how unsafe it was for her niece.

Margaret had a favorite teddy bear. One day, her dog tore it apart. Margaret was heartbroken. Her mother got to work sewing the bear back up. Margaret wasn't happy the bear survived. Margaret cherished the repaired bear.

Greg went to the library to find a book. He wanted a mystery to start right away. He searched in the computer for that genre. He ended up finding a murder mystery. He sat down and played a game on his phone. He went to the desk, check the book out and started reading.

A mom took her kids to a family restaurant to eat. One of her kids was squealing with joy and laughter. Patrons at another table complained that the kid was too loud. They passed the mother an angry note. The mother was happy to receive the note. The mother got offended and told them off.

I was ill-prepared for my final exam coming up. I decided to make a cheat sheet to use in class. I was nervous but needed an A. I put my cheat sheet in my palm and used it. The teacher caught and suspended me. I was very proud of myself.

I was at the laundromat last Sunday. There was a cute girl doing her laundry there too. I went up and started making small talk. She smiled but didn't seem interested. I left her alone but kept sneaking little glances. I bought her a dress that afternoon.

Ali always takes the train to get to work each day. One day she was very sick but still went to work. She worked hard all day and even took work home. She got on the train and fell asleep. She was a lazy employee. She missed her stop and had to take a bus home.

Alex was trying to build a birdhouse. He spent almost an hour putting together the walls. When he went to put the roof on, he realized that it didn't fit. He had made a mistake with the walls. Alex then finished the birdhouse. Alex decided to start over from the beginning.

Gina had severe indigestion. She knew this was all her fault. She had eaten way more than she could hold. Now it was coming back up. Gina had a big dinner later that evening. Gina had to take the day off from school.

One time my friend Alex found a dog wandering by itself on his way to school. He picked it up and decided he was going to keep it. After that, he brought it home and gave it a name. The dog continued to grow for many years. The dog and Alex grew to old age together. They still enjoy each other's company to this day.

Last week I ran into the cutest girl ever. We were both at the grocery store and our eyes met. I mustered up the courage to ask for her number. She said no. I went on about my day. She gave me her number.

When Rick was six, his father gave him an allowance. Rick had to clean his room once a week to get the allowance. The first week, he forgot to clean his room. He cried when his father didn't give him an allowance. His dad praised him for his hard work. Rick learned a valuable lesson that week.

Gordy tried making some toast last Tuesday morning. He wanted to have a decent breakfast for once. He waited and the bread never warmed. He finally realized that the toaster wasn't plugged in. He plugged the toaster in. Cody threw the broken toaster away.
Tim was playing chess. He lost the game. This made him angry. He decided to study the game to be better at it. He became the younger grandmaster at age sixty. Soon, he was the best player in town.

Rory loved to eat chocolate. One day, she went to the candy store. She spent all of her allowance on chocolate bars. Rory ate all of the chocolate on the way home. Rory got very sick and vomited all over the sidewalk. Rory went to a restaurant and ate a huge meal.

My grandmother always hated cats. She died last year. I inherited her rocking chair. My cats are usually sitting in it. My grandmother liked visiting me. I'm not sure how my grandmother would feel about that.

Gina was putting posters on her bedroom walls. There was a poster of the cool new girl group. The girls were wearing bright colored clothing. Gina herself was wearing a brown shirt and khakis. Gina decided she would wear more colorful clothing. Gina decided to start wearing black.

Gina and her friends were feuding. She was the only one who was an outcast. The other girls were getting along great. Gina kept her head down and kept working. Working always made people vanish. Gina was depressed because her friends were ignoring her.

Tom was studying for the big test. He then fell asleep due to boredom. He slept for five hours. He woke up shocked. Tom hurried to study as much as possible before the test. Tom felt prepared for the test.

I was making lunch for school. I tried to find the peanut butter, but there wasn't any. I ended up packing ham instead. My lunchbox got hot in my locker. These were the perfect conditions for the ham sandwich I craved. The ham got all slimy and I had no lunch.

Brittany knitted scarves. She tried to make each one unique. She was making a scarf for her father. She put a snake design on it. Now Brittany's father wears a boa around his neck. Brittany's father loved his solid blue scarf.

Diane noticed her kids were bored and getting crabby. She purchased a kite and string at the discount store. After picking up the kids, she drove to an open field. Surprisingly, there was no fighting as they assembled the kite. Sour faces all around told Diane the kids hated the new kite. Smiling faces all around told Diane the kids loved the new kite.

My first concert was so much fun. I went to see Kanye West perform during his Glow in the Dark tour. He had so much energy and passion as he sang. I could still fee the music in my chest when the concert was over. I left that concert feeling happier than ever. I felt like I had wasted my money.

Kathy needed to get to work. The ice in the driveway prevented her from moving the car. She tried putting salt, and sand but nothing helped. Finally, a neighbor came by to help. The neighbor ended up just driving her to work himself. The neighbor had a history of minor kleptomania.

Tonya loved to play the piano. One day, while she was playing a song, her piano broke. Tonya was upset because she needed to practice. She had the piano repaired, but it didn't sound the same. She hit it with a hammer. Tonya decided to buy a new, better piano, and it was perfect.

Amy's class was going to the museum on a field trip. Amy was excited to view the King Tut exhibit. Amy asked the information desk where to find the exhibit. The lady informed her the Exhibit left the month before. Amy became sad. Amy had good timing.

I purchased a T-Shirt on eBay. Since my screen's brightness was low, I didn't see the shirt's color. The package came during the end up the week. I decided to open the box quickly. The t-shirt was a terrible color and I hated it. The t-shirt was a terrible color and I loved it.

This year the American Idol auditions came to Philadelphia. Since Jen only lived two hours away, she auditioned for the show. She arrived at the stadium among thousands of other contestants. Jen was so nervous when she stood in front of the judges. Jen enjoyed her dinner with the judges. Jen surprised the judges with how well she sang.

Patrick was down on his luck. He tried mugging a man on the street. The man he attacked was an undercover police officer. The officer quickly took Patrick down. The judge sent Patrick to a rehab house. Patrick was sent to jail.

The Jones family went to the beach every year. They loved their vacation home that they always visited. A hurricane came and wiped away the entire community. The vacation home was destroyed and no longer stood there. The Jones family was happy about the house. The Jones family wept over their house.

Amy was swimming in the ocean on her vacation. Suddenly she felt a horrible sting. Looking down, she saw a jellyfish swimming away. Amy crawled onto the beach in agony. Amy felt much better. Amy went to the doctor for treatment.
Jerry loved running everywhere. He ran to school and back. He ran to the store. One day there was a beautiful sunset. Jerry continued to run. Jerry stopped running.

I visited Harvard Square in 2004. I watched the chess hustlers play speed chess. I put down five dollars and played a game. I played three more games and lost fifteen dollars. I felt glad I won. It was a learning experience.

At the time it seemed like a good idea. The bus driver parked and went into a bathroom at a gas station. Andre jumped in the driver's seat and drove off. He drove to three stops and picked up passengers. But then the cops stopped him. The bus company congratulated him on being a good passenger.

Sahil was a huge football fan. He loved the team Manchester United but had never seen them play. Sahil entered a competition to attend a football game. Sahil won the competition. He sold his ticket on eBay. He got to attend the game.

Natalie went out of her way to make people unhappy. She wanted other people to be as unhappy as her. She primarily worked with petty insults. She made people self-conscious, and they left her alone. Natalie made friends very easily. Natalie died a bitter crone, loved by no one.

Mike always had golden retriever dogs when he was growing up. Now that he had a steady job, he felt ready to have a dog on his own. His mom had never let him because she said having a dog required too much physical work for someone like Mike. Mike got a Golden Retriever and named him Spot. Mike enjoys taking Spot on his daily jogs. Mike loves his faithful friend Spot very much.
I called Carly to ask her on a date. I got her voicemail. I texted her that we should talk soon. She texted me back, asking why we should talk soon. I told her I hated her. I told her I liked her.

Daniel loved baseball more than anything in the world. His favorite team was the Boston Red Sox. Daniel's dad took him to a game at Fenway Park for his birthday. Daniel caught a home run ball in the nineth inning. Daniel wished he hadn't gone to the ballpark at all. Daniel told his dad that it was the happiest day of his life.

A man turned away from his dinner to answer the telephone. When he turned back, his dinner was gone. He looked around and saw his dog quietly sneaking out of the room. The dog chanced a glance back at the man. The dog gave birth to a litter of puppies. The dog had gravy on his face from the man's dinner.

Haley was doing gymnastics after school. She stayed longer than everyone else. During a tumble, she fell and hurt her neck. There was nobody there to help. Haley continued to perform gymnastics until her mom came. Haley screamed until a teacher came and helped her.

My husband absolutely loves watching football. Every Saturday during football season, we watch the games on television. We put on our football jerseys and invite our friends over. Mark decided that he wanted a new puppy. Excited, he drove to the animal shelter. Once there, he wandered around and looked at all of the cats and dogs. A golden lab caught his attention. Mark adopted a parrot. Mark adopted the lab.

Bill always feels gross leaving the city touching so many public things. He found a water tap but the water was too hot. He mixed some cold water in order to make it normal. When water was normal then he could clean up. He applied soap on top of his hands. He applied hand soap on his face.

The Audubon Roast was at a new location this year along a koi pond. The waterfront was beautiful, but the dock didn't have railings. A woman fell into the water. Several people raced to help her out. Amelia was upset because she lost her phone. She had all her pictures saved on the phone. Her friend said she will forward all the pictures tomorrow. Amelia cheered up. Amelia realized her phone was under her pillow. Amelia didn't miss her phone.

I had two dogs that were very close. The older dog got very sick and was put to sleep. The younger dog was very lonely. We have a neighbor dog come over to play. Our dog really enjoys having the house to himself. Our dog feels much better playing with another dog.

Sandra was going on a date for the first time in a long time. She was nervous and hoped the man would like her. He picked her up promptly and took her to dinner.
